docs.lead_paragraph: After four fatalities at Aqueduct’s meet, which opened Dec. 12, the New York State Racing and Wagering Board said necropsies would be performed on all horses that sustain deadly racing injuries.

headline.seo: Aqueduct Breakdowns Lead to Order for Necropsies
headline.main: Horse Deaths at Aqueduct Stir Action by State Board
headline.print_headline: Horse Deaths at Aqueduct Stir Action by State Board

docs.abstract: New York State Racing and Wagering Board announces that it will order necropsies for all horses that sustain deadly racing injuries on Aqueduct's inner dirt track following four fatalities at the racetrack's meet.
docs.snippet: After four fatalities at Aqueduct’s meet, which opened Dec. 12, the New York State Racing and Wagering Board said necropsies would be performed on all horses that sustain deadly racing injuries.

keywords.value: New York State Racing and Wagering Board
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention were not alarmed, urging Americans to continue to get flu shots, which they acknowledged were not completely effective.

headline.seo: Flu Deaths Reach Epidemic Level, but May Be at Peak
headline.main: Flu Season Deaths Reach Epidemic Level but May Be at Peak, C.D.C. Says
headline.print_headline: Flu Season Deaths Reach Epidemic Level but May Be at Peak, C.D.C. Says

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention officials say deaths in current flu season have officially stepped into epidemic territory, but add there are early signs that caseloads could be peaking; urge Americans to get flu shots despite fact that they are only moderately effective.
docs.snippet: Officials from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention were not alarmed, urging Americans to continue to get flu shots, which they acknowledged were not completely effective.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: After laboratory studies and driving tests confirming the risks of next-day drowsiness, the Food and Drug Administration said that women should be taking half as much.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Requires Cuts to Dosages of Ambien and Other Sleep Drugs
headline.main: Drug Agency Recommends Lower Doses of Sleep Aids for Women
headline.print_headline: Drug Agency Recommends Lower Doses of Sleep Aids for Women

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration says women should be taking half as much of prescription sleep aids like Ambien, after laboratory studies and driving tests confirmed risks of next-day drowsiness; about 60 million prescriptions were dispensed in 2011, up about 20 percent since 2006.
docs.snippet: After laboratory studies and driving tests confirming the risks of next-day drowsiness, the Food and Drug Administration said that women should be taking half as much.

byline.contributor: Andrew Pollack contributed reporting from San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was only a matter of time before Hollywood, where antidepressants are common as after-dinner mints, turned them into a high-stakes movie thriller.

headline.seo: Antidepressants Give Soderbergh a Thriller’s Plot

docs.abstract: Director Steven Soderbergh's latest film Side Effects, crime thriller informed by psychiatrist Sasha Bardley's experiences at Bellevue Hospital prison ward, has a complex plot that centers around the use of prescription antidepressants; Soderbergh insists the movie, which may rankle the pharmaceutical industry, will be his last feature film.
docs.snippet: It was only a matter of time before Hollywood, where antidepressants are common as after-dinner mints, turned them into a high-stakes movie thriller.

headline.main: For Drug Users, a Swift Response Is the Best Medicine

docs.abstract: An initiative in Vermont has shown that, for drug offenders, quick intervention and treatment, not drawn-out court punishments, work best.
docs.snippet: An initiative in Vermont has shown that, for drug offenders, quick intervention and treatment, not drawn-out court punishments, work best.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials could not say for sure whether the low growth reflected the start of a trend or the continuing effects of the recession.

headline.seo: Health Spending Growth Stays Low for 3rd Straight Year
headline.main: Growth of Health Spending Stays Low
headline.print_headline: Growth of Health Spending Stays Low

docs.abstract: Obama administration says that national health spending climbed to $2.7 trillion in 2011, or average of $8,700 for every person in country, but remained stable as share of economy for third consecutive year; officials cannot say for sure whether low growth represents start of trend or reflects continuing effects of recession.
docs.snippet: Officials could not say for sure whether the low growth reflected the start of a trend or the continuing effects of the recession.
